intro: Silene pseudoatocion var. oranensis, commonly known as the Oranese campion, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variant is notable for its limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
